title: Where do American math teachers find the worksheets that they give students in class? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends. I write many of my own, or use some written by teachers I have worked with in the past, but most textbook publishers provide them  -- and it makes sense to use worksheets that follow the notation  and order of subjects of the  textbook you are using. There certainly are many online sites that have worksheets, too, of varying quality but many are pretty indistinguishable from the ones you'd get from a publisher [for better or worse]. For example (and just as an example, I'm not implying they are good or bad): World of Math Online
